name: United States Virgin Islands
description: The United States Virgin Islands (USVI) are a captivating archipelago in the Caribbean Sea, comprised of St. Croix, St. John, and St. Thomas. Known for their pristine beaches, vibrant coral reefs, lush rainforests, and rich history, the islands offer a unique blend of relaxation, adventure, and cultural experiences.  The USVI boast a diverse ecosystem, a fascinating blend of European, African, and indigenous influences, and a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population is a mix of long-term residents and seasonal visitors.
quickFacts.detail: St. Croix has the largest population, followed by St. Thomas and St. John.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: The islands are relatively small, making them easy to explore.
quickFacts.detail: St. Croix is the largest island at 123 square miles.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The US dollar is the official currency.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: English is the official language, with Creole dialects also spoken.
quickFacts.detail: Spanish is also understood and spoken by many residents.

quickFacts.label: Average Temperature
quickFacts.detail: Temperatures fluctuate slightly between the islands.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: The USVI enjoy a consistently warm and humid tropical climate, influenced by trade winds. Rainfall is distributed throughout the year, with a slightly wetter season from June to November.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Hot and humid with frequent showers.  Ideal for swimming and water activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Fall (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The start of the rainy season, with occasional hurricanes. Still warm and sunny, but with more precipitation.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The driest and coolest time of year, with pleasant temperatures and less humidity.  A popular time to visit.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Transition period with warm temperatures and increasing rainfall.  A good balance of weather conditions.

naturalWonders.name: Buck Island Reef National Monument
naturalWonders.description: A protected coral reef and island offering exceptional snorkeling and diving opportunities. It's a haven for diverse marine life and a significant historical site.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Buck Island is a volcanic tuff cone rising from the sea, surrounded by a vibrant coral reef teeming with colorful fish, sea turtles, and other marine creatures. The island also holds historical significance as a 17th-century Spanish fort.

naturalWonders.name: Virgin Islands National Park
naturalWonders.description: A vast expanse of pristine rainforest and coastline, offering unparalleled hiking and nature experiences.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: St. John’s Virgin Islands National Park encompasses nearly 70% of the island, protecting its unique ecosystem and stunning natural beauty. The park features numerous hiking trails, secluded beaches, and diverse plant and animal life.

naturalWonders.name: Cinnamon Bay
naturalWonders.description: A beautiful white-sand beach with calm waters, perfect for swimming and relaxation.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Cinnamon Bay is known for its stunning turquoise waters, powdery white sand, and lush tropical vegetation. The bay offers excellent snorkeling opportunities and is a popular spot for picnics and beach games.

ecosystemData.title: Diverse Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: The USVI boast a remarkable diversity of ecosystems, ranging from vibrant coral reefs and lush rainforests to mangrove swamps and coastal wetlands. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life, contributing to the islands' unique biodiversity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Life
biodiversityCategories.description: The surrounding waters are home to a vast array of marine species, including coral, fish, sea turtles, and dolphins.

statistics.details: Diverse coral formations create vibrant reef ecosystems.
A wide variety of colorful reef fish inhabit the waters.

notableSpecies.name: Green Sea Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A keystone species in the marine ecosystem.

notableSpecies.name: Humpback Whale
notableSpecies.significance: Breaches in the waters during the winter months.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forest Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: The islands' interior is covered in dense rainforests, supporting a wide range of plant and animal life.

statistics.details: Diverse tree species contribute to the rainforest's biodiversity.
Numerous bird species inhabit the rainforest canopy.

notableSpecies.name: Red-tailed Boa
notableSpecies.significance: A native snake species found in the rainforest.

notableSpecies.name: Puerto Rican Coqui Frog
notableSpecies.significance: A unique frog species endemic to the islands.

activities.title: Outdoor Adventures
activities.description: The USVI offer a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the islands' diverse trails and stunning landscapes.

activities.name: Lind Point Trail
activities.description: A scenic trail along the coastline of St. John.

activities.name: Drake's Seat Trail
activities.description: Offers panoramic views of Magens Bay.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters with a variety of water activities.

activities.name: Snorkeling
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life.

activities.name: Scuba Diving
activities.description: Discover the underwater wonders of the USVI.
